    version: 0.9

    List

    Easily create nice looking lists, which come in different styles.

    Usage

    To apply this component, add the .list class to an unordered or ordered list. The list will now display without any spacing or list-style.

    
						<ul class="list">
							<li>List item 1</li>
							<li>List item 2</li>
							<li>List item 3</li>
						</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<ul class="list">
										<li>List item 1</li>
										<li>List item 2</li>
										<li>List item 3</li>
									</ul>

    Divider modifier

    Add the .list-divider class to separate list items with lines.

    <ul class="list list-divider">…</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<ul class="list list-divider">
										<li>List item 1</li>
										<li>List item 2</li>
										<li>List item 3</li>
									</ul>

    Striped modifier

    Add zebra-striping to a list using the .list-striped class.

    <ul class="list list-striped">…</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<ul class="list list-striped">
										<li>List item 1</li>
										<li>List item 2</li>
										<li>List item 3</li>
									</ul>

    Hiding List Bullets

    Apply .list-no-bullets modifier class to remove the list markers and all left padding.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<ul class="list list-no-bullets">
										<li>List item 1</li>
										<li>List item 2</li>
										<li>List item 3</li>
									</ul>

    Size modifier

    Add one of the following classes to increase or decrease the spacing between list items. You can combine this with any of the other list modifiers.

    Class Description
    .list-large Larger padding and spacing between items.
    .list-condensed Smaller vertical padding for compact lists.
    .list-collapse Removes vertical padding and spacing between items.

    Large modifier

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<div class="grid col-4">	
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-large">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-large list-no-bullets">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-large list-divider">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-large list-striped">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
									</div>

    Condensed modifier

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<div class="grid col-4">	
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-condensed">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-condensed list-no-bullets">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-condensed list-divider">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
										<div>
											<ul class="list list-condensed list-striped">
												<li>List item 1</li>
												<li>List item 2</li>
												<li>List item 3</li>
											</ul>
										</div>
									</div>

    Collapse modifier

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    • List item 1
    • List item 2
    • List item 3
    
									<div>
										<ul class="list list-collapse">
											<li>List item 1</li>
											<li>List item 2</li>
											<li>List item 3</li>
										</ul>
									</div>
									<div>
										<ul class="list list-collapse list-no-bullets">
											<li>List item 1</li>
											<li>List item 2</li>
											<li>List item 3</li>
										</ul>
									</div>
									<div>
										<ul class="list list-collapse list-divider">
											<li>List item 1</li>
											<li>List item 2</li>
											<li>List item 3</li>
										</ul>
									</div>
									<div>
										<ul class="list list-collapse list-striped">
											<li>List item 1</li>
											<li>List item 2</li>
											<li>List item 3</li>
										</ul>
									</div>

    Clickable List

    Apply the .list-clickable modifier class to change the cursor to a pointer, indicating that list items are interactive elements.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Clickable Item 1
    • Clickable Item 2
    • Clickable Item 3
    
									<ul class="list list-clickable">
										<li><a href="#">Clickable Item 1</a></li>
										<li><a href="#">Clickable Item 2</a></li>
										<li><a href="#">Clickable Item 3</a></li>
									</ul>

    Split List (Two Columns)

    Use the .split-list class to format the list into two balanced columns on larger screens. The list automatically reverts to a single column on smaller devices.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Item A
    • Item B
    • Item C
    • Item D
    
									<ul class="list split-list">
										<li>Item A</li>
										<li>Item B</li>
										<li>Item C</li>
										<li>Item D</li>
									</ul>

    Hoverable List

    Add the .list-hoverable class to apply a subtle background color to list items when the user hovers over them with their mouse.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Hoverable Group 1
    • Hoverable Group 2
    • Hoverable Group 3
    
									<ul class="list list-hoverable">
										<li class="list-group">Hoverable Group 1</li>
										<li class="list-group">Hoverable Group 2</li>
										<li class="list-group">Hoverable Group 3</li>
									</ul>

    Bullet & Marker Styles

    Change the default bullet style by applying one of the available modifier classes: .list-disc, .list-circle, .list-square, .list-decimal, or .list-hyphen.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Disc
    • Disc
    • Circle
    • Circle
    • Square
    • Square
    • Decimal One
    • Decimal Two
    • Hyphen One
    • Hyphen Two

    Marker Color Modifiers

    Easily change the color of the list markers by adding a color modifier class: .list-primary, .list-secondary, .list-emphasis, or .list-muted.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Muted
    • Muted
    • Primary
    • Primary
    • Emphasis
    • Emphasis
    • Secondary
    • Secondary
    
									<ul class="list list-disc list-muted">
										<li>Muted</li>
										<li>Muted</li>
									</ul>
									<ul class="list list-disc list-primary margin-top">
										<li>Primary</li>
										<li>Primary</li>
									</ul>
									<ul class="list list-disc list-emphasis margin-top">
										<li>Emphasis</li>
										<li>Emphasis</li>
									</ul>
									<ul class="list list-disc list-secondary margin-top">
										<li>Secondary</li>
										<li>Secondary</li>
									</ul>

    Utility Classes

    Use the .list-secondary-text class inside a list item to style sub-text with a muted color and truncate it with an ellipsis if it overflows.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Main text Secondary text
    • Main text Secondary text wrapped
    • Default text Secondary text
    • Multi-line secondary text Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

											Main text
											Secondary text

												dolore magna aliqua.
											
										
      •

    List Group with Addon and Body

    Use .list-group to structure list items with optional .list-addon for icons, avatars, or controls, and .list-body for titles and descriptions. By default .list-body wrapps. Add .no-wrap to prevent wrapping

    • Preview
    • Markup

    • Alice Johnson

      Frontend developer, UI/UX enthusiast.

    • ★

      Starred Item

      An example with an icon instead of an avatar.

    • Charlie

      Product manager, loves clean documentation.
